questions.answer_description:
Box 1: Enrollment restrictions -
As an Intune administrator, you can create and manage enrollment restrictions that define what devices can enroll into management with Intune, including the:
✑ Number of devices.
✑ Operating systems and versions.

Box 2: Device categories -
To make managing devices easier, you can use Microsoft Intune device categories to automatically add devices to groups based on categories that you define.
Device categories use the following workflow:
✑ Create categories that users can choose from when they enroll their device.
✑ When users of iOS/iPadOS and Android devices enroll a device, they must choose a category from the list of categories you configured. To assign a category to a Windows device, users must use the Company Portal website.
✑ You can then deploy policies and apps to these groups.
✑ You can create any device categories you want. For example:
- Point-of-sale device
- Demonstration device
- Sales
- Accounting
- Manager
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/enrollment/enrollment-restrictions-set https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/enrollment/device-group-mapping

You need to ensure that the users enroll their iOS device in Intune.
What should you configure first?
questions.answer_description:
You need to create an Apple MDM push certificate and use it to manage Apple devices with Intune. The Apple MDM push certificate must be added to Endpoint
Manager, and must be active.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/enrollment/apple-mdm-push-certificate-get

discussion.content: Correct: D .

comments.content: Click on Apple MDM Push certificate and at the top of the screen it says "Configure MDM Push Certificate"

On the iOS enrollment page, it literally says "Intune requires an Apple MDM Push certificate to manage Apple devices, and supports multiple enrollment methods. Set up the MDM push certificate to begin. Learn more."

I have done this several times and I can tell you that:

It is literally impossible to configure an "Enrollment program tokens" before you configure "Configure MDM Push Certificate" (APN). The intune portal does not allow you to do that.

So the answer to this question is still to first configure an apple push cert (answer D) and after that you configure the enrollment program token.

Even then after configuring that, your apple devices themselves need to be registered as DEP/Autoenrollment in Apple Business Manager or Apple School Manager, this can be done either by buying the devices DEP enabled or adding them manually to DEP by using the Apple Configurator 2 software.

Then Devices also need to be assigned to an enrollment profile. After that, and also only from the Apple device setup wizard (Intune integrated or not) the users will be forced to enroll their devices.
